headline.main: Governing is harder than conquering; Yitzhak Rabin: After father and mother figures, a native son rules Israel. Rabin

docs.abstract: Amos Elon article on Premier Rabin; discusses his rise to power, pol career and difficulties with Israel's domestic problems; illus of Rabin, with Golda Meir, with David Ben-Gurion and with wife (L)
docs.lead_paragraph: TEL AVIV. Premier Yitzhak Rabin settled wearily into his chair and lit another cigarette from a stub smoked down to his fingertips. He spoke sadly, slowly, in a low, grinding voice. A citrusscented breeze wandered into the book-lined study of his Tel Aviv penthouse apartment, but in the brilliant light of the Mediterranean morning his eyes were squinty, tired, tense.
